thread.title: Two injured in car crash outside hospital
thread.title_full: Two injured in car crash outside hospital

title: Two injured in car crash outside hospital
text:
Car hits pedestrians at Withington Hospital, Manchester 7 March 2017 These are external links and will open in a new window Close share panel Image caption The accident happened in a car park on Nell Lane outside Withington Hospital Two people have suffered life-threatening injuries after a car hit pedestrians outside a hospital in south Manchester. 
A man and a woman were injured in the car park at Withington Hospital at 14:05 GMT, the ambulance service said. 
The woman is more seriously hurt and has been taken to Wythenshawe Hospital, while the man has been taken to Manchester Royal Infirmary. 
The driver of the car, a man in his 80s, is talking to police at the scene. 
Two fire crews are assisting the ambulance service, Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service said. Related Topics
